wikipedia_page.main: George Keith Griffiths (30 December 1927 – August 2015) was an English professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper in the Football League for Chester.

response: Signed by Chester from Liverpool in 1958, he made his professional debut in a 2–2 draw at Walsall on 11 September 1958. He became the third Chester goalkeeper to appear for the first team that season after Brian Biggins and Keith Griffiths, but new signing Ron Howells was to become regular keeper from the next game and Owen did not reappear until the final match of the 1959–60 season against Southport.Sumner (1997), stats section (59-60)
*Keith Griffiths (architect) (born 1954), Chairman of Aedas International and Founder and benefactor of the Griffiths-Roch Foundation
*Keith Griffiths (filmmaker), producer of The Piano Tuner of Earthquakes
*Keith Griffiths (rugby league), see List of Parramatta Eels players
